posts.cooked: Does anyone know if there is a way to run a command as uninterruptible. I looked at 2022 and saw it but cant find it in 2023. Our problem is when in auto our drive forward command gets run it interrupts all our other commands. if anyone can help that would be great
You could have a parallel race group that contains the commands you want to run and it will finish when all your commands in the group have finished.

Hey, can you share the part of the code that you are concerned about?

I want to look in the code and understand what might cause the problem.

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked: I think you mean a parallel command group, a parallel race group finishes when the first command in it finishes I think
Ah yeah that’s what I meant.
Also, if a command is using the same subsystems the it will end the first one.

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
It would help if you posted your code to take a look.  Making an auto command uninterruptable is a code smell that something else is wrong with your software architecture.

You can always put your subsystem on SmartDashboard and see what is scheduled for your drivetrain when it’s getting interrupted by something else for context.

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked: I agree with @NewtonCrosby , it’s a code smell and you probably have a problem to fix. But to answer the OP’s question, you can run a command uninterruptible by using .withInterruptBehavior(InterruptionBehavior.kCancelIncoming)
